Package io.artframework

Interface TargetProvider

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Provider, Scoped
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultTargetProvider
    public interface TargetProvider
extends Provider
    Provides a way to create different Target implementations for different target types. Register your Target and TargetProvider in the Configuration by calling add(Class, Function).
    See Also:
    Target

      • of

        static TargetProvider of​(Scope scope)

      • all

        java.util.Collection<java.lang.Class<?>> all()
        Returns:
        a list of all registered target types

      • get

        <TTarget> java.util.Optional<Target<TTarget>> get​(@Nullable
                                                  TTarget source)
        Tries to wrap the given target source into a Target. The source can only be wrapped if an appropriate Target type provider has been added with the add(Class, Function) method.

        Will return an Optional.empty() if no matching target for the given source type is found or if the provided target source is null.

        The target provider will try to select the nearest possible match for the given source types. This means that if you register a generic fallback provider of type Object, every target source will get wrapped by that provider if no other provider is found.

        Type Parameters:
        TTarget - type of the target source
        Parameters:
        source - The source to get a Target for
        Returns:
        wrapped Target source or an empty Optional

      • exists

        <TTarget> boolean exists​(@Nullable
                         TTarget source)
        Checks if a Target provider for the given source type exists.
        Type Parameters:
        TTarget - type of the target source
        Parameters:
        source - The source to check. Can be null.
        Returns:
        true if a provider exists or false if the target source is null or no provider exists

      • add

        <TTarget> TargetProvider add​(@NonNull
                             @NonNull java.lang.Class<TTarget> sourceClass,
                             @NonNull
                             @NonNull java.util.function.Function<TTarget,​Target<TTarget>> targetProvider)
        Adds a Target implementation for the given type to this provider. You can register only one provider per type. Any existing provider will be overwritten silently. It is possible to register subtypes and supertypes of the given target type. When getting a Target the provider will always select the nearest possible match.
        Type Parameters:
        TTarget - type of the target source
        Parameters:
        sourceClass - The class of the source type.
        targetProvider - Function to create a new instance of the given Target wrapper.
        Returns:
        this TargetProvider

      • addAll

        TargetProvider addAll​(@NonNull
                      @NonNull java.util.Map<java.lang.Class<?>,​java.util.function.Function<?,​Target<?>>> targets)
        Adds all provided targets to this provider.
        Parameters:
        targets - the target types that should be added
        Returns:
        this provider

      • remove

        <TTarget> TargetProvider remove​(@NonNull
                                @NonNull java.lang.Class<TTarget> sourceClass)
        Removes the given source type as a Target provider. Will do nothing if no target provider for the given source type exists.
        Type Parameters:
        TTarget - Type of the source.
        Parameters:
        sourceClass - The class of the source type.
        Returns:
        this TargetProvider

      • clear

        TargetProvider clear()
        Removes all configured Target source types. Make sure you add(Class, Function) Target source types after removing everything. Probably nothing will work without at least one valid Target type.
        Returns:
        this TargetProvider
